title: PSG fans raise the roof as triumphant players hold aloft Champions League trophy
summary: The winners of European club soccer’s biggest prize arrived in Paris on Sunday afternoon and headed to France's most famous avenue: the Champs-Élysées. The team later met with French President Emmanuel Macron and first lady Brigitte Macron at the Élysée Palace, with players wearing club tracksuits and PSG jerseys.

title: The German army and its ghosts
summary: Created by the Allies 10 years after World War II to help defend Western Europe, the German army was designed to fight as little as possible. Today, Berlin wants to make it 'fit for war,' but the institution is struggling to break free from its extremely complex history.

title: Several injured, possibly with burns, in a Colorado attack the FBI is investigating as terrorism
summary: In Boulder, a man appears to have set people on fire during a peaceful gathering to raise awareness for the Israeli hostages held in Gaza.

title: Poland on a knife’s edge as exit poll shows a near tie in runoff
summary: Polling stations opened for a tight presidential election runoff that will have major implications for the country's role in Europe, and for abortion and LGBTQ rights.

title: Ukraine claims it damaged $7 billion worth of Russian aircraft
summary: The long-planned operation came at a delicate moment three years into Russia's invasion, just one day before a second round of planned peace talks between Russian and Ukrainian officials in Istanbul.

title: Bruce Springsteen in Le Monde: From disillusioned singer to anti-Trump activist
summary: The American rock icon's name first appeared in the pages of Le Monde on November 22, 1975, coinciding with the release of his third album, 'Born to Run.'

title: US envoy says France can 'carve' Palestinian state out of the Riviera
summary: The US ambassador to Israel Mike Huckabee has said that there is 'no such thing as an occupation' when it comes to the Palestinian territories, and that 'If France is really so determined to see a Palestinian state [... ] carve out a piece of the French Riviera.'

title: Mexicans elect their judges under shadow of organized crime
summary: Voters will choose around 880 federal judges, including Supreme Court justices, as well as hundreds of local judges and magistrates. Another election for the remainder will be held in 2027

title: Libyan militia battles in Tripoli spark public anger
summary: For the third time since May 14, demonstrations took place Friday in the Libyan capital. Khalifa Haftar, who controls the east and south of the country, remains poised to take advantage.

title: For Nasser Al-Khelaifi, PSG's versatile and 'untouchable' president, triumph marks a crowning achievement
summary: At the helm of the Parisian club since its acquisition by his country's sovereign wealth fund 14 years ago, the Qatari has become one of the most influential figures in global football.

title: Ukrainian ground forces commander resigns after Russian strike on training ground
summary: Mykhailo Drapatyi said he felt a 'personal sense of responsibility' following the Russian missile attack, which killed at least 12 Ukrainian soldiers and wounded more than 60.

title: Young people with disabilities face online fetishization
summary: On social media and dating sites, users with disabilities frequently receive messages from strangers who fetishize their disability. This form of Cyberbullying, considered ableist, has sometimes led them to delete their accounts.

title: PSG's Champions League victory hailed as 'story of revenge and redemption' by international media
summary: On Saturday night in Munich, after years of disappointment, the Paris club finally added its name to the list of winners of European football's most prestigious competition, defeating Inter Milan 5-0. 'Suffering only makes it sweeter,' observed the foreign press.

title: Two dead, 559 arrested during Champions League final celebrations, says French Interior Ministry
summary: A 17-year-old was stabbed to death and another person riding a scooter was hit by a car on Saturday night during celebrations for PSG's win.

title: At least 7 dead after Russian bridge collapses onto railway
summary: Moscow Railways, a state-owned subsidiary, said a passenger train derailed 'between Klimov and Moscow due to the collapse of a road bridge span, as a result of illegal interference in the operation of transport.'

title: Macron calls for 'coalition of independents' amid increasing threats from China and the US
summary: Invited to deliver the keynote speech at the Shangri-La Dialogue, a defense and security forum for Asia, the French president condemned the 'whims' and 'greed' of the two great powers, once again advocating for a 'third way.' His American counterpart warned Beijing against invading Taiwan.

title: Over 1,100 migrants crossed English Channel on Saturday, a record since beginning of 2025
summary: The rise in crossings come despite harsh measures by both the French and British governments to curb immigration.

title: UK anti-obesity legislation falls victim to food industry lobbying
summary: Keir Starmer's Labour government announced the delay of new, stricter rules limiting advertising for 'ultra-processed' foods.
